Friday 17th October

6pm – 9.30pm

[/vc_column_text][vc_video link=”https://youtu.be/LGdp47szmnE?si=gHWp8LXCw7OvrkoV” css=””][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1754926233283{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]

The Black Finance Talks brings together senior finance leaders, successful entrepreneurs, and wealth-building experts to share their experience building successful careers while navigating the financial services sector.

Through candid discussion and practical sessions, attendees will learn how to advance their careers, secure funding for new ventures, and build long-term wealth strategies. Whether you’re climbing the corporate ladder or launching a business to disrupt the sector, this event provides the tools and connections needed to succeed in an industry where Black talent remains underrepresented.

Join this collaborative community of finance professionals and entrepreneurs committed to creating pathways for the next generation of Black leaders and innovators in finance.

Key themes:
1. Learn the secrets behind positioning yourself for senior roles and leadership opportunities in top organisations
2. Discover innovative funding pathways and proven techniques to secure capital and scale your business
3. Discuss how to leverage smart financial planning and strategic investment approaches to build long-term financial security
4. Navigate corporate finance culture and industry dynamics to establish your position confidently within the industry
5. Access the mentors, coaches, and connections needed to accelerate your personal and career development

Fisayo Martins

Chartered Accountant & Founder, Finance Matters UK

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Chartered Accountant and former Banking & Finance professional with a decade of experience, Fisayo is the founder of Finance Matters UK, a platform championing financial education and wellbeing. With a community of 62,000+ individuals, she is a trusted voice helping individuals and business owners build strong financial foundations. Alongside her continuous mentoring for aspiring Finance professionals, Fis shares her experience as a seasoned investor in the property and stock market as a means to empower others to build long-term wealth.

text_direction=”default”]

Deji Davies

Director, Brentford Football Club & Managing Director, Head of EMEA Loan and CLO Trading, J.P. Morgan[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Deji Davies is a Managing Director at J.P. Morgan, where he is Head of EMEA Loan and CLO Trading. In his role he invests in and trades a broad selection of leveraged companies across multiple sectors. He has been at J.P. Morgan for over 18 years, prior to which he was at Rothschild, where he started his career in finance. Deji is Chair of the Inclusion Advisory Board (IAB) at The Football Association (The FA) and is also a Director at Premier League football club Brentford F.C., having joined the board in July 2021. Deji is an Ambassador for the education charity Awaken Genius and has founded numerous mentoring programs targeting disadvantaged young people. Deji has a degree in Economics & Management from the University of Oxford.

Adbul Buhari

Client Advisor, Global Wealth Management, UBS[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Abdul Buhari is a Client Advisor based in London with 18 years of experience in banking, including a decade in wealth management. He began his career in securities within the investment banking sector, where he gained extensive expertise across fixed income, equities, and prime brokerage. In 2015, Abdul transitioned to the private bank, where he now manages a diverse portfolio of clients.

In addition to his professional achievements, Abdul is a retired discus thrower who represented Great Britain at the 2012 London Olympic Games, as well as at European and World Championships. Following an injury, Abdul retired from competitive athletics in 2014 and now dedicates time to coaching and mentoring athletes across various sports.

Since transitioning into wealth management, he has specialised in serving clients, delivering strategic financial guidance underpinned by the discipline and excellence that defined his athletic and professional careers.

Demi Ariyo

Founder, Lendoe[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Demi Ariyo is the Founder and Managing Director of Lendoe, a pioneering finance platform providing access to funding for underestimated founders. With a background in investment and peer-to-peer lending, Demi has arranged millions in funding for entrepreneurs overlooked by traditional banks. Recognised by HSBC, Forbes, and The Great British Business Awards, his work has also been featured in the BBC Three documentary Spending Black, The Guardian, Business Insider, and the Financial Times.

Edwin Appiah

General Partner, Cornerstone VC[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Edwin Appiah is an early-stage investor, board member, and former Coutts International Banker, where he advised more than a hundred owner-managed businesses across the UK, Europe, and the Americas.

He’s a founding General Partner at Cornerstone VC and also sits on the investment committee for Imperial College’s Enterprise Fund. He represents Cornerstone on the Development Bank of Wales Investment Forum, which supports businesses rooted or relocating to Wales.

Edwin is an active angel investor and co-founded the Cornerstone Partners Angel Network, one of the UK’s first syndicates focused on backing diverse founding teams. Today, he leads Cornerstone VC’s new investments and works closely with their portfolio companies.

One of his standout investments includes Definely, an AI contract drafting solution that recently closed a $30 million Series B round.

Emmanuel Asuquo

Financial Adviser, Author & Speaker[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Emmanuel Asuquo is a regulated financial adviser, bestselling author, TV presenter, and dynamic  keynote speaker with over 15 years in the financial services industry. Raised in a council estate in East  London by Nigerian parents, Emmanuel defied the odds to become Barclays’ youngest financial  adviser at just 22. He is the author of two powerful books, Get Your Money Right and The Ultimate  Guide to Money, both aimed at helping individuals take control of their finances.

Habee Folami

Director of EDI, People & Culture, METRO Charity[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Habee Folami is the Director of EDI, People and Culture at METRO Charity, where she leads the organisation’s people strategy, HR function and culture transformation. As a consultant, she has supported over 50 organisations, including the British Red Cross, Sony Pictures Entertainment, and the LEGO Group. Habee is recognised for her combination of operational expertise, commercial acumen and compassionate leadership. Her advocacy for equity was significantly influenced by her involvement in sport, as a world champion powerlifter who challenged gender stereotypes in a male-dominated sport. Today, she empowers organisations to translate inclusive values into strategy, culture and measurable change.

Since transitioning into wealth management, he has specialised in serving clients, delivering strategic financial guidance underpinned by the discipline and excellence that defined his athletic and professional careers.

Joan Boyle

Head of Legal Investment Management & Transactions, Standard Life[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Joan Eliaika Boyle is a corporate finance solicitor based in the City of London with experience across M&A, capital markets, and asset management. She provides legal advice to corporates, financial institutions, insurers, tier 1 banks, and conglomerates on corporate governance, risk management, investments and transactional matters. Her work includes negotiating securities documentation, share purchase agreements, and asset management mandates.

Joan is the most senior Black colleague at Phoenix Group Holdings plc, a FTSE-100 listed company with over 6,600 employees. Joan actively mentors high-performing colleagues from diverse backgrounds to promote diversity of thought in the workplace.

Beyond law, Joan is an avid art historian. In her spare time, she paints and creates ceramics.

Lámidé Elizabeth

Host of Building Wealth with No Borders Podcast, Co-Founder of the ProfessionElle Network, & CEO, WNB Group[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Lámidé started her wealth building journey over 8 years ago determined to have a better financial future than the one she grew up with. Her pursuit of understanding money and wealth led her to study at the London School of Economics and she consequently joined JP Morgan and Citi investment bank to learn more about money and the world of finance. She purchased her first property in the UK just 6 months after graduating and went on to purchase a property internationally at the tender age of 24. She has reached her goal of financial independence in her mid-20s, investing and moving seamlessly between the UK and the UAE. Lámidé is eager to share strategies on how others can do the same and now hosts the Building Wealth with No Borders podcast, the largest black-led, wealth-focused podcast in the UK. She also supports investors with investing in property overseas.

Tara Attfield-Tomes

Founder, East Village Agency & The 51% Club[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Tara Attfield-Tomes sits at the heart of the West Midlands ecosystem, as an advisor and consultant in female entrepreneurship. She has a passion for mobilising female founders to drive change and generate wealth for women.

A founder herself, she runs The 51% Club, a thriving community to help female founders scale beyond their wildest dreams. With over 800 members (and counting!) across the West Midlands, Warwickshire, and Worcestershire the community delivers events and resources to support women-led ventures, including a fully-funded 12-week growth programme and The Fortuna Fellowship, a first-of-its-kind accelerator that includes the opportunity to pitch for a share of £2 million investment.

She also runs multi-award-winning EAST VILLAGE, a PR agency for female-serving brands that supports early stage to Series A ventures with their founder profiling, media positioning, and market growth.

Stefan Johnson

Local Director – London Region, SME Business Banking, HSBC UK[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Stefan Johnson is an award-winning Creative Entrepreneur turned Corporate Banker, and Director of SME Business Banking for HSBC UK in London. He leads a team of Relationship Managers supporting SMEs with turnovers up to £25m, helping ambitious businesses unlock growth through trusted relationships and innovative funding solutions.

Stefan’s journey into banking was unconventional – trained in broadcasting, he founded a media production company before pivoting into commercial finance. This creative background uniquely shaped his approach to finance, blending storytelling, strategy, and customer-first thinking.

Stefan is passionate about mentoring the next generation of leaders and creating opportunities for underrepresented entrepreneurs and professionals. His leadership style is rooted in transparency, inclusion, and high agency.

His biggest challenge day-to-day? Being the proud co-founder of three young children!

Rachel Shorter

Founder, Antilles Network & Group Finance Director, Cerulean[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Rachel Shorter is a seasoned finance executive and the founder of Antilles Network, a wellness and empowerment collective for Black women across the UK. She is currently serving as the Group Finance Director for Cerulean Limited, a multinational manufacturing business, where she leads with a strong focus on financial resilience, strategy, and cross-border collaboration.

With over 15 years of experience in European finance, Rachel’s career has been rooted predominantly in the manufacturing sector, where she has led large-scale transformations and helped businesses navigate change with confidence and clarity.

In addition to her corporate leadership, Rachel is passionate about purpose-led finance. She actively collaborates with charitable organisations, offering guidance on financial stewardship, sustainable growth, and governance.

Rachel is dedicated to shaping spaces where financial literacy, personal growth, and community intersect.

Josh Ngondo

Commercial Manager, Institute of Directors[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Josh Ngondo is a visionary leader committed to fostering diversity and inclusion within the most senior 

levels of the business. He is committed to empowering marginalised business leaders with the tools needed to succeed at senior levels. With a focus on solutions over problems, he champions embedding an inclusive culture at the Institute of Directors (IoD).  This is characterised by the way he has used his status and platform to create fully sponsored Professional Development opportunities for Black Business Show attendees, worth over £180k.

Melina Mavoungou

Head of Finance & Strategy, UK Black Business Week & Show[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Melina is a seasoned Accountant with a decade of experience in finance, having worked across a diverse range of sectors including Marketing, Pharmaceuticals, Private Healthcare, and Events. She is dedicated to driving financial excellence and strategic growth within organisations.

Melina’s commitment to meaningful change was sparked during her tenure at BUPA amid the Black Lives Matter movement. Recognizing the need for systemic change, she took the initiative to lead several Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) initiatives. By challenging existing norms and advocating for progressive policies, she played a pivotal role in encouraging leadership to embrace a more inclusive and equitable workplace. 

Today, Melina is instrumental in shaping the strategic development of the UK Black Business Week & Show, guiding its direction and scale, and ensuring the financial sustainability and growth of the venture year after year.
